body:
This user-powered update brings two new features for Guildmasters:

Guildmasters can now "herald" their posts and comments, marking them as an official proclamation of the guild. While a post remains inside the guild, the crown icon will stay gold. If the post moves guilds, the crown will turn grey.

Additionally, comments can now be pinned to the top of the page.

Heralding was developed by @seq37 and comment pinning was developed by @l1terally_h1tler.

Guildmasters can now "herald" their posts and comments, marking them as an official proclamation of the guild. While a post remains inside the guild, the crown icon will stay gold. If the post moves guilds, the crown will turn grey.

Additionally, comments can now be pinned to the top of the page.

Heralding was developed by @seq37 and comment pinning was developed by @l1terally_h1tler.

body_html: Thanks to everyone involved. Like the changes

post.body:
This user-powered update brings two new features for Guildmasters:

Guildmasters can now "herald" their posts and comments, marking them as an official proclamation of the guild. While a post remains inside the guild, the crown icon will stay gold. If the post moves guilds, the crown will turn grey.

Additionally, comments can now be pinned to the top of the page.

Heralding was developed by @seq37 and comment pinning was developed by @l1terally_h1tler.

post.body:
This user-powered update brings two new features for Guildmasters:

Guildmasters can now "herald" their posts and comments, marking them as an official proclamation of the guild. While a post remains inside the guild, the crown icon will stay gold. If the post moves guilds, the crown will turn grey.

Additionally, comments can now be pinned to the top of the page.

Heralding was developed by @seq37 and comment pinning was developed by @l1terally_h1tler.

body:
It's the Ruqqus equivalent of reddit's green [M] for moderator distinguish.

The color change is to signify that "this was distinguished, but by a mod of a different guild, not the current guild"

body:
Definitely agree with @Banido here. @captainmeta4 The commits being pushed to master are still quite inconvenient (see attached screenshot). I have to keep looking at the code change to see what it is. There's an [Allow merge commits](https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/administering-a-repository/configuring-commit-squashing-for-pull-requests) GitHub setting that you can toggle. May be good to disable that, which will prevent merges to master that aren't squashed.

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/comment/kuo1/PyD9o1cVUiE)
